conclusion: The question asks about changes in shadows A, B, C, and D when the light source moves backward.
The image shows four objects above slabs casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D.
When the light source moves backward, the distance between the light source and the objects increases.
As the distance between the light source and the objects increases, the shadows cast by the objects will become larger due to the increased angle of the light rays.
Since the light source is moving backward, the shadows will also move backward, away from the objects.
Therefore, A, B, C, and D will all move backward and become larger as the light source moves backward.
